info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 23 at 7:26PM MDT until June 23 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Central Luna County in southwestern New Mexico... Southwestern Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico...
* Until 830 PM MDT.
* At 723 PM MDT, outflow from showers and thunderstorms south of the international was pushing north towards I-10. While radar sampling is not ideal, a wall of blowing dust may develop and push across Interstate 10 between Gage, Deming, and Las Cruces in the next hour. This outflow will also modify the air mass across southern New Mexico, and boost humidity, and may finally trigger thunderstorm development across the region this evening.
HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Doppler radar.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 65 and 139, and between mile markers 141 and 149.
Locations impacted include... Las Cruces, Deming, Afton, Akela, Mesilla, Fairacres, Sunshine, Rock Hound State Park, Afton Generating Plant, San Pablo, Picacho, Uvas Valley, Corralitos, Waterloo, Las Cruces West Mesa, Southern New Mexico State Fairgrounds, Deming Ranchettes, Spring Canyon State Park, Aden Crater, and Mesilla Valley Bosque State Park.
info.instruction: Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
